newsitem.title: USA: LEHMAN LAUNCHES NEW MODEL PORTFOLIO.
newsitem.headline: LEHMAN LAUNCHES NEW MODEL PORTFOLIO.

text.p: Lehman Brothers said it launched a new model investment portfolio, the "U.S. Strategy Portfolio," that differs from prior model portfolios by not limiting itself to stocks covered by Lehman analysts.

"This will give us a better read on what our clients are doing," said Arun Kumar, senior U.S. equities strategist at Lehman Brothers. "And hopefully this will help our clients as well because we are doing this the way they would, not putting artificial constraints such as if the stock is not covered by Lehman we wouldn't put it in the portfolio."
The "overweighted" industry groups in the portfolio are fiancials, with 26 percent, technology, 23 percent, and capital goods and health care, each with 14 percent.
The stocks with the largest positions in the portfolio are Microsoft Corp, 5.7 percent; American International Group Inc, 5.6 percent; Intel Corp, 5.5 percent; and Citicorp 5.0 percent.
Basic materials, communication services, consumer cyclicals, consumer staples, energy, transportation and utilities are underweighted in the portfolio, Lehman said.
No groups are given market weight.
